page.title: 09Sway Tower.
page.content: A very impressive historic building stands in the village of Sway on the edge of the New Forest. Sway Tower, which dominates the local landscape, was built in the 1880's by Andrew Peterson. It was one of the first multi storey concrete structures to be built in Britain and stands 66.4464m high. The solid concrete walls are 60cm thick at the bottom tapering to 30cm at the top. Concrete was mixed on site with stones from nearby Milford beach then hauled up using a horse powered hoist and tipped into the 45cm deep shuttering. When the concrete was dry the shuttering was moved up to the next level. No scaffolding was used.Employment on the construction of the tower in the 1880's earned local people 5s (25p) a day.
